title: Luton Town 3-1 Forest Green Rovers
description: Late goals from Olly Lee and Pelly-Ruddock Mpanzu ensure Luton finish second in League Two with victory against Forest Green.
content:
Late goals from Olly Lee and Pelly-Ruddock Mpanzu ensured Luton finished second in League Two with victory against Forest Green.

The hosts went close early on as Mpanzu sent an effort wide, while visiting keeper Cameron Belford made superb saves from Dan Potts and Danny Hylton.

The deadlock was broken on 20 minutes, though, James Collins seeing his shot saved by Belford, only for Hylton to score his 50th goal for the club.

Belford then denied Hylton once more, parrying Elliot Lee's 20-yarder too.

He was at it again soon after, stopping Hylton once more with a fine reflex save, before James Shea kept out Scott Laird's attempt.

After the break, Rovers levelled when leading scorer Christian Doidge was given too much time in the area to rifle home on 53 minutes.

Reuben Reid was inches away from making it 2-1 with an angled drive, while Reece Brown's effort was saved by Shea.

With five minutes to go, though, Lee swept in Harry Cornick's cross, with Mpanzu adding the late gloss in injury time.
